lead_paragraph: A series of raids from South Sudan killed an estimated 182 people. Survivors are asking: If the attacks were about cattle, why did so many people die?

headline.print_headline: Attacks Leave Hospital Filled and Questions in Ethiopia
headline.main: Deadly Attacks in Ethiopia Leave Victims Wondering Why

snippet: A series of raids from South Sudan killed an estimated 182 people. Survivors are asking: If the attacks were about cattle, why did so many people die?
abstract: Gambela Hospital in western Ethiopia is packed with wounded following series of attacks by cattle raiders from South Sudan that left 182 Ethiopians dead; many speculate attacks, which were unusually violent for livestock theft, were sanctioned by government.
